Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2014 07:32PM - edited Dec 13, 2014 07:33PM by Kboom21 hi Kristen, I am also Kristin!  I am 33 and history of one cyst 7 years ago that only had one ultrasound, never monitored more other than self exams. In the past two weeks, 6 other lumps and one possible mass were found by clinical exam. I go in for diagnostic mamo and u/s with biopsy Monday.  The feeling you describe about when your milk used to come in....I tried telling my MD that. Like I noticed a heaviness in that one breast particularly and almost sometimes like a crawly and occasional uncomfortable feeling. She did not look like she was getting what I was explaining, but the feeling of milk coming in is exactly it. Thank you for the words. I hope your results turn out well. Stay off Dr Google this week
Posts.Title: Waiting for mammo and U/S Terps Moderators

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2014 09:53PM Kboom21 wrote: Daisylover - you bet I will push for MRI if the others show nothing. I'm supposed to have a biopsy with the ultrasound if they find anything. If I get negatives from both mammogram and u/s, I will be placing another call for more orders. ILC scares me because the "fibrous changes" I feel, feel like the "thickening" you describe. My skin is fine, it's the tissue underneath that just feels "harder" and heavier than usual. Thank you ladies for the insight. Will be thinking of you all as well! I get that twinge feeling, well, more likely a "crawly" feeling in my left breast just by my nipple. I will definitely heed every single one of the pieces of advice given here. I appreciate all the messages and insight, really do!
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Kboom21 wrote: I am 33 years old and have had one child (2 years old). Breast fed to about 10 weeks post partum and then dried up. My left breast never really produced much. History: Back in 2007 a small "lump" was found just next to my nipple, close to the surface. Ultrasound showed nothing, literally nothing. The tech couldn't even look at the screen and figure out where the area of the concern was (bad tech?). Anyways, since then, we have been watching the area. The lump remains the same, no growth or changes I can detect. However, over the past 8 weeks or so, I've been doing weekly self breast exams and have noticed that the area near the top of my breast toward the collarbone and into the arm pit feels "lumpier" and thicker. I've also noticed a little nipple discomfort now and then which sometimes feels like a "tickle" and/or "itch." I feel like my breast feels a little heavier and just has a difference "presence." This is very hard to describe! I don't get periods as I have the Nexplanon arm implant for the past year. I am going in today at 2:00 PM for a clinical breast exam. I'm going to push for a mammogram after reading that it could be anything from fibrocystic breast changes to in situ cancers, etc. Of course, part of me is worried, and another part trying not to set myself up quite yet. No family history of BC, just very dense fibrous breasts. Anyone with similar symptoms and what ended up being your path? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2014 08:47PM - edited Dec 8, 2014 08:47PM by Kboom21 Just left the clinic. Without telling doc where I found my suspicious area other than what breast, she found a few lumps in the armpit area of my right breast and a few larger ones in the left armpit (2), and 1 above my left nipple. She noticed the change in fibrous tissues as well. She wholeheartedly believes they are cysts, but to calm anxiety and fears we ordered a mammogram with a follow up ultrasound and biopsy as needed. I am currently sitting in the Clinic parking lot waiting for the order to be faxed over so I can call and make the appointment. I did ask about the breast MRI, but do to insurance purposes we have to go through the mammogram and ultrasound first. However she said if the discomfort and pain persist in the other results are negative it is something we can definitely consider
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2014 03:33PM Kboom21 wrote: I head in this afternoon for diagnostic testing. I have attempted to wean down my caffeine intake over the past week. I did notice that some of the cysts that I was able to feel before are nearly unpalpable. Confident those are fluid filled cysts now at this point. There is one lump that did not change nor did the rubbery oblong 'lump' next to it. Those are still very much palpable and present and I'm still getting some pain/sensitivity in that area around the nipple. I do realize it quite possibly is a fibroadenoma from all the reading I've done here. I will post more when I know more.
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2014 01:38PM - edited Dec 16, 2014 05:30PM by Kboom21 Well I don't have much to go off of yesterday. I went in for my 2:30 appointment. Was to have a diagnostic mammogram first. I got in the mammo room, put on my BB markers and the tech walked out saying she'd be right back. I waited 20 minutes......another lady called me and asked me to step out of the room and walk with her. I was confused to say the least, she brought me back to ultrasound. I asked her why we were doing the u/s first and not the mammo as ordered. She replied, "the radiologist said you don't need a mammo and we don't typically do them on women under age 35 (I'm 33.5)." I told her, "the order is for a mammogram, ultrasound and biopsy if needed. She asked if she should talk again with the radiologist and I told her to go right ahead or I would be happy to call my physician who ordered the testing. I reminded her, the testing was ordered because more lumps and fibrocystic changes were found, not because I just 'wanted' a mammogram. Like I wanted to be there in the first place? I waited on the u/s table for another 5-7 minutes. Then the first tech came back and asked me to come with her back to the mammo room and said "well, I guess it looks like we are doing this after all. I asked him if he was sure, and he said to get it done." So who was the one really second guessing WHY I should not have a mammo done? So diagnostic mammo is finished and I'm brought back to the u/s room again. Tech literally looked around two areas on my left breast (order was for both breasts), took 3 pictures and went to get radiologist. He comes in, fishes around for 2 minutes only on left breast and says all clear and that it is just really glandular tissue I probably feel. No one walked me out. They all left and I was left to clean up myself and escort myself back to the dressing room. I am furious. I feel like I was not taken seriously or treated like an actual patient. I'm 33, so apparently to them I didn't warrant kindness? I have a few people I know under the age of 35 that go to this same breast center and they have never been treated like that....maybe it was a case of the Mondays, I don't know. I asked for my BIRADS, the radiologist said I would get the report in the mail. I go in for my annual next month and I'll be talking to my physician about the experience and plan to possibly file a grievance with the hospital on the way I was treated and rushed when finally in doing the testing. Needless to say, I would like to have someone else look at my mammo and do an u/s just to be sure. I'm sure there is likely nothing since the radiologist believed the mammo was clear, but feeling rushed like that when in the testing and then totally disregarded because of my age makes me feel like maybe they took quick glances and not a thorough look, makes me have doubts. However, I am happy with the results of course, pending they ARE correct. I plan to just give it some additional time until I have my annual and wait and see if the pain/burning dissipates on its own before then. I will rejoice being on the good end of news at this time though.
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2014 10:07PM Kboom21 wrote: I definitely would be okay with benign :) I am doing ok. Only cried once so far but that was with the physician! I think i read a statistic today that said 8 out of 10 lumps are benign? So the odds are in favor with my low risk history. Hope you are doing well, looks like you are on Tamoxifen now for almost 9 months?
Posts.Title: Dense breasts - noticed thickening Kboom21 Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2014 01:29PM Kboom21 wrote: Char-you stated my sentiments exactly. I am sick of hearing, well you are only 33 and no family history, it is probably nothing. And they are likely right, probably nothing. But the possibilty of possibly something still lurks in my brain. I have my mammo, u/s and aspirations/biopsies on Monday.  Kris-I am too a Kristin. And I am so sorry you were given the news you were. How are you doing
Posts.Title: Abnormal Mammo and US. Biopsy next. kris1114 kris1114

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2014 04:52AM Kboom21 wrote: There are some posts about complex cysts. I'm sure others can fill you in more. I'm 33 as well and going in for mamma and u/s with biopsy today for "cysts." What I have researched about complex cysts is that they have either noticed a shadowing inside the cysts or debris, indicating there is some solid particles or matter inside. Usually with these, they like to biopsy that matter to ensure it is benign. I hope that helps answer your question? Vascularity inside the cyst means there is blood flow to the particles or matter. Not sure how this affects outcome of malignant versus benign, but as a nurse, my gut says they may be concerned the matter inside could be cancerous. Do you have family history or other risk factors? Lymph nodes can swell and reside on their own as they filter bacteria and viruses regardless of whether they could have cancer cells in them. Depending on outcome of your cyst biopsy will determine whether they will be concerned about the node.
Posts.Title: Can anyone tell me exactly what this means? ankemom Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2014 07:51AM Kboom21 wrote: Ugh, sorry you had to get the news it was not a hematoma. I'm a nurse and the one thing that bothers me the most in medical professionalism (of lack thereof) is when a doctor, surgeon or other professional is in a "hurry" to get to the next appointment without explaining things or answering questions. We (and insurance) pays for that healthcare, so the time with them should be leaving the patient with all questions answered that can be. I still have 3 days until my mammogram and ultrasound/biospy. I'll be waiting a little longer for those benign results (staying positive). I understand risk factors are low and I'm sick of hearing that. I'm young, 33. Only risk factor was having first live birth after age of 30 and only breast feeding for 8 weeks (story in itself). I know many without family history who have brca. Just waiting for that all-clear. I pray and hope that yours comes back benign!!! Keep your chin up! Positive vibes and energy coming your way!
Posts.Title: "Cysts" that aren't and one that may be Sauron... FrodoBaggins Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2014 10:01AM Kboom21 wrote: I have not had mine confirmed just yet, but I suspect that one of the 6 "cysts" that I will have mammogram, submit to ultrasound and likely biopsied next Monday, will come back solid. It feels much different than the rest. And like yours, "runs away" when my MD tried to palpate it. I will let you know what comes of that visit. I very much hope that your biopsies come back clean as well! We can wait on our results together? Provided the radiologist decides to biopsy mine (you better believe I am going to push for it). I had one of these 6 since 2007, and the other 5 appeared to be palpable just in the last 8 weeks (I do not get my periods, so they are not menstrual cycle related). Thinking of you <3
Posts.Title: "Cysts" that aren't and one that may be Sauron... FrodoBaggins Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2014 12:27PM - edited Dec 10, 2014 12:31PM by Kboom21 Did the doc/tech doing your ultrasound run the Doppler to see if that 1cm "stinker" cyst was vascularized? I was feeling around my main cyst, the one I've had for years now. I noticed this morning, that if I "move" it off to the side a little, I can feel a blob right up against it. Part of it feels nearly just has hard as the cyst, but the rest of it almost feels like rubber. My MD nor myself noticed that at the breast exam on Monday. The cyst and this blob are also right under/next to my left areola, about 6/7 o'clock position.....so very similar to you Frodo.
Posts.Title: "Cysts" that aren't and one that may be Sauron... FrodoBaggins Kboom21

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2014 12:35PM Kboom21 wrote: That is WONDERFUL news!! I am so happy for you! Yay - dance and rejoice! I maybe will be on again when/if I get a second opinion. I'm waiting on the hospital/breast center to release my records to me. Once I can look them over myself (I'm a nurse), then I plan to call my physician about the experience. Pending results of that conversation, I will probably go get the second opinion. In the meantime, I am happy with the initial outcome of course. My best friend is battling IDC Stage I, Grade 3 right now so I see the struggle. Nothing I want personally. Just want simple confident confirmation that it is nothing and to be taken seriously, regardless of age. My first time being discriminated against, I guess you could say!

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2014 05:06PM Kboom21 wrote: So sorry you have to be here and go through this. I hope things turn out well. I too have a mammo and u/s on Monday afternoon. Mine is nothing like yours however. Just several lumps that popped up over the past few months with a history of a cyst 7 years ago that still persists today (last mounted 7 years ago diagnostically). My doc was not sure if one area was a cyst or a mass, so she wants all of them checked out. Keep your chin up and I completely understand being scared and having that gut feeling. But here, you are not alone. Many women you will be able to connect with if those results don't come up negative. But I sure hope they do. Positive energy and good vibes coming your way.
